name: Kepler-311
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-311 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-311 is a star with 1.3639999999999999 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.19 times its radius. It is located 2597.93 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-311 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-311 b

Kepler-311 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 9.18 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-311.

The mass of Kepler-311 b is 3.46 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-311 b is 1.7 that of Earth. At 3.46 Earth masses, Kepler-311 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-311 c

Kepler-311 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 19.74 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-311.

The mass of Kepler-311 c is 2.29 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-311 c is 1.43 that of Earth. At 2.29 Earth masses, Kepler-311 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-311, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
